data.title: Fix a wrong check in LeavesTrails.
data.body:
![dfj](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1136302/16673045/f0ed4492-44aa-11e6-9395-214524cf8ecb.gif)

Fixes #11595.

Checking for WasStationary there was redundant.

The bug is caused by the WasStationary check - if StartDelay is 0 then it will imminently spawn a new trail in the starting position and will load the stationary delay for moving actors.

data.title: LeavesTrails is bugged.
data.body:
![tfdfguf](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1136302/16672484/b00c2fdc-44a6-11e6-8ef5-783fb1d7c5b3.gif)

When a unit starts moving, it skips the first cell. TS mod.

data.title: Allow RA LST to travel on beach tiles
data.body:
Giving the poor LST some love. Now can travel on beach tiles at 70% speed. Allows for much faster loading and unloading and matches the FMVs more accurately.
![beach](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/16669877/8b294022-448f-11e6-9a5d-e81cdd7d8b23.jpg)Makes a massive difference to awkward landing zones (like the spit of land jutting out to the bottom right)

data.title: AUTHORS still lists Mono.Nat.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body: @lontivero isn't credited.

data.title: Fix smudges spawning/growing on cells occupied by structures or vehicles

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
With this, the `LeaveSmudge` warhead checks the target type(s) of actors on affected cells, rather than only caring about the terrain.

This can be used to prevent craters or scorches spawning and growing under buildings and vehicles, which matches the behavior in the originals and looks more realistic anyway.

Also, but not related, the explosion sound of TD artillery weapon was not playing because it was listed as uppercase, this is fixed as well.

Fixes #6464.

data.title: "Error:CodePage 936 not supported"
data.body: Here's Ubuntu 15.10 using Chinese language. After finishing downloading any of the three assets of dune 2000, Red Alert or Tiberian Dawn, it says "Error:CodePage 936 not supported". The release is 20160508. Could it be fixed? Or is there anything I should do? Thx!

data.title: Add white border to countdown timers
data.body: It is very hard to read the timers of players who have selected a dark color. Perhaps a white border would help them stand out against the fog of war.

data.title: Add timestamp to exception.log
data.body:
Came up after questioning if a pasted crash log was dated or not. We're almost always able to look at the file write time but this hopefully doesn't hurt.

Sample:

```
Red Alert Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
on map 065791667982ccb50a4c3acdd6c752430db9a4a8 (Behind The Veil by Kyrylo Silin).
Date: 2016-07-06 19:48:15Z
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Commands.DevCommands+DevException`: Exception of type 'OpenRA.Mods.Common.Commands.DevCommands+DevException' was thrown.
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Commands.DevCommands.InvokeCommand(String name, String arg)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Commands.ChatCommands.OnChat(String playername, String message)
...
```

data.title: Can not create OpenGL context. (Error: Video subsystem has not been initialized)
data.body:
Installed openra from the .deb file, and all its dependencies. Upon startup it displays the error to look at the logs. 

From exeption.log:

`Operating System: Linux (Unix 4.4.0.21)
Runtime Version: Mono 4.2.1 (Debian 4.2.1.102+dfsg2-7ubuntu4) CLR 4.0.30319.17020
Exception of type`System.InvalidOperationException`: No suitable renderers were found. Check graphics.log for details.
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) <0x41a8d990 + 0x00733> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) <0x41a53a80 + 0x0004b> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) <0x41a52d60 + 0x000f7> in <filename unknown>:0`

And from graphics.log:

`System.InvalidOperationException: Can not create OpenGL context. (Error: Video subsystem has not been initialized)
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Sdl2GraphicsDevice..ctor (Size windowSize, WindowMode windowMode) <0x41ad3fc0 + 0x004bb> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.DeviceFactory.CreateGraphics (Size size, WindowMode windowMode) <0x41ad3f70 + 0x0003b> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Renderer.CreateDevice (System.Reflection.Assembly platformDll, Int32 width, Int32 height, WindowMode window) <0x41ad3b40 + 0x00199> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Renderer..ctor (OpenRA.GraphicSettings graphicSettings, OpenRA.ServerSettings serverSettings) <0x41ad32d0 + 0x00107> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) <0x41a8d990 + 0x00357> in <filename unknown>:0 
System.InvalidOperationException: Can not create OpenGL context. (Error: Video subsystem has not been initialized)
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Sdl2GraphicsDevice..ctor (Size windowSize, WindowMode windowMode) <0x41ad3fc0 + 0x004bb> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.DeviceFactory.CreateGraphics (Size size, WindowMode windowMode) <0x41ad3f70 + 0x0003b> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Renderer.CreateDevice (System.Reflection.Assembly platformDll, Int32 width, Int32 height, WindowMode window) <0x41ad3b40 + 0x00199> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Renderer..ctor (OpenRA.GraphicSettings graphicSettings, OpenRA.ServerSettings serverSettings) <0x41ad32d0 + 0x00107> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) <0x41a8d990 + 0x00357> in <filename unknown>:0`

I have an HD4000 integrated that supports openGL 3.0.

data.title: Overhaul D2K installed content.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
This switches D2K to the 1.06 content, which lets us remove a bunch of files from the bits directory, and lets us install content from an existing gruntmods d2k install.

The new download pages are temporarily hosted on dropbox until we can get some mirrors online (cc @baxxxster).

Fixes #2344.
Fixes #11351.

data.title: Expand SelfHealing.
data.body:
Adds a percentage healing option and damagetypes.
Depends on #11513 (also can be used as a justification of that PR).

Includes testcase.

data.title: Debug menu: some option checkboxes blink during enabling/disabling.
data.body:
Must be a recent regression. Tested on the CNC mod.

Unaffected settings: Show A\* Cost, Show Actor Tags, and all the four options in the bottom right (Show \* Geometry and Custom Terrain). The top checkboxes and Show Unit Paths are affected.

data.title: Force firing on a submerged unit plays an explosion animation instead of splash
data.body:
But does no damage. 

In RA mod, on bleed.

data.title: WithTextDecoration: Move exception to Info via IRulesetLoaded
data.body:
```
Exception of type `System.AggregateException`: One or more errors occurred.
Inner Exception of type `OpenRA.YamlException`: Actor type nahand: Could not find font 'NoWayJose'
```

data.title: Deploying overrides queued actions (except MCV)
data.body:
It seems the MCV is the only unit that can deploy after queued actions (waypoints). 
Other deployable units can't do that (APC, Chinook, Nuke Truck, ...) the deploy action will override all the previous queued actions.

For instance, it is impossible to tell a nuke truck to follow waypoints, then explode at the last waypoint. (Shift + RMB on the truck will make it explode instantly).
However, with a MCV, it's possible.

data.title: Implement support for TargetType-specific (in-)accuracy
data.body:
One C&C1-exclusive feature that we're still not supporting is higher inaccuracy of tank cannons versus infantry.

The best I could think of would be to add `ValidTargets`/`InvalidTargets` to `InaccuracyMultiplier` and then only apply that to valid targets, but I'm neither 100% sure that's the best approach nor sure how exactly that would be implemented the cleanest way.

data.title: Server: Object reference not set to an instance of an object   at OpenRA.Network.UPnP.ForwardPort
data.body:
When running inside a docker container (`openra_release.20160508_all.deb` on Ubuntu 16.04) with

``` shell
mono --debug /usr/lib/openra/OpenRA.Server.exe Game.Mod=ra \
Server.Name"=Docker based server" Server.ListenPort=1234 \
Server.ExternalPort=1234 Server.DisableSinglePlayer=true \
Server.TimeOut=240000 Server.AdvertiseOnline=true
```

OpenRA server crashes:

```
Unhandled Exception:
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Network.UPnP.ForwardPort (Int32 lifetime) <0x4102c170 + 0x000ac> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Server.Server..ctor (System.Net.IPEndPoint endpoint, OpenRA.ServerSettings settings, OpenRA.ModData modData, Boolean dedicated) <0x41003fb0 + 0x00503> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Server.Program.Main (System.String[] args) <0x40f845e0 + 0x00283> in <filename unknown>:0 
[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Network.UPnP.ForwardPort (Int32 lifetime) <0x4102c170 + 0x000ac> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Server.Server..ctor (System.Net.IPEndPoint endpoint, OpenRA.ServerSettings settings, OpenRA.ModData modData, Boolean dedicated) <0x41003fb0 + 0x00503> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Server.Program.Main (System.String[] args) <0x40f845e0 + 0x00283> in <filename unknown>:0 
```

data.title: Maps created with FinalSun/FinalAlert without header crash the game upon import
data.body:
``` ini
[Preview]
Size=0,0,180,60
```

gets imported as:

``` yaml
MapSize: 90,120

Bounds: 2,4,86,116
```

They then crash the game like https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10686.

data.title: Prevent non-combatant players from receiving units from crate pickups
Expose the WeatherOverlay to lua
data.body:
Closes #11538.

A testcase can be found at my [lwTest branch](https://github.com/abcdefg30/OpenRA/tree/lwTest).

data.title: Add building depth imposters for TS base structures.
data.body:
This takes us another small step towards enabling the new depth rendering in TS.

When testing you can quickly toggle between normal and depth rendering using the <kbd>`</kbd> key.
